citation.article-title: Pigmentiphaga litoralis sp. nov., a facultatively anaerobic bacterium isolated from a tidal flat sediment.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Pigmentiphaga litoralis sp. nov.
Pigmentiphaga litoralis (li.to.ra′lis. L. fem. adj. litoralis of or belonging to the seashore).
Cells are Gram-negative, non-sporulating, non-motile, catalase- and oxidase-positive, facultatively anaerobic, straight to slightly curved rods, approximately 0.5–0.8 μm wide and 1.0–2.5 μm long.

Colonies are yellow-pigmented, somewhat convex and non-translucent, with glistening surfaces and circular/slightly irregular margins, and are 1–2 mm in diameter after incubation for 3 days at 28 °C on TSA.
Growth occurs with 0–5 % (w/v) NaCl [optimum, 0.5–1 % (w/v) NaCl], at pH 5.0–10.0 (optimum, pH 7.0) and at 4–35 °C (optimum, 25–30 °C).
Aesculin is hydrolysed, but casein, gelatin, hypoxanthine, starch, l-tyrosine, Tweens 20, 40, 60 and 80, urea and xanthine are not.
Voges–Proskauer test and citrate utilization are positive.
Nitrate is not reduced to nitrite.
H2S and indole are not produced.

Positive for activity of acid phosphatase, alkaline phosphatase, arginine dihydrolase, cystine arylamidase, esterase lipase (C8), α-glucosidase, β-glucosidase, lysine decarboxylase, ornithine decarboxylase and naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase (API ZYM and API 20E).

No activity is observed for α-chymotrypsin, esterase (C4), α-fucosidase, α-galactosidase, β-galactosidase, β-glucuronidase, N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase, lipase (C14), leucine arylamidase, α-mannosidase, trypsin, urease or valine arylamidase (API ZYM and API 20E).

Arabinose, glucose, inositol, malate, maltose, mannitol, mannose, rhamnose, sorbitol and sucrose are utilized, but N-acetylglucosamine, adipic acid, amygdalin, capric acid, gluconate, melibiose and potassium phenylacetic acid are not (API 20E and API 20NE).
Acids are produced from d-fructose, d-glucose, glycerol, d-lactose, maltose, d-mannitol, d-ribose, sucrose, trehalose and d-xylose (API 50 CH).
Major fatty acids (>10 % of the total) are C16 : 0, cyclo C17 : 0, C18 : 1ω7c and C16 : 1.
The predominant respiratory quinone is ubiquinone Q-8, and the polar lipids are phosphatidylglycerol, phosphatidylethanolamine and an unidentified phospholipid.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 65.5 mol% (HPLC method).
The type strain, JSM 061001T (=CCTCC AA207034T=KCTC 22165T), was isolated from a tidal flat sediment sample collected from the shore of Naozhou Island, Leizhou Bay, South China Sea, China.
